----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

d13C(CH4) data of the clean air monitoring station Neumayer

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Institut für Umweltphysik (IUP)

University of Heidelberg, Germany

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

LAST UPDATE: 03/2011

CONTRIBUTORS: C.Veidt, C.Poß, and I. Levin

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

SAMPLING LOCATION:

Neumayer station, Dronning Maud Land, Antarctica

70.65°S   8.25°W  42m a.s.l.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

REFERENCES:

C. Veidt PhD thesis in preparation

Levin I., C. Veidt, B. H. Vaughn, G. Brailsford, T. Bromley,
R.Heinz, D. Lowe, J. B. Miller, C. Poß, and J. W. C. White
No inter-hemispheric d13CH4 trend observedNature, Vol.486, 28.6.2012, 
pages E3-E4, doi:10.1038/nature11175

NOTE: PLEASE CITE THE LATTER REFERENCE WHEN USING THIS DATA

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

13C/12C ratios of CO2 derived from catalytical combustion of the extracted CH4
samples were measured with a dual inlet mass spectrometer (MAT 252, Finnigan).
Hence d13C(CH4) results are NOT affected by the Kr-effect described in
J. Schmitt et al., AMT 2013, DOI: 10.5194/amt-6-1425-2013.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

SCALE:

mole fraction on NOAA04 scale

d13C is reported as deviation from the standard VPDB in permil
d13C(CH4) values are shifted to NIWA-scale:
d13C(NIWA) = d13C(UHEI) + 0.169 permil

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Columns 1 to 3: date of sampling (Neumayer: spot samples)
Column 1: year
Column 2: month
Column 3: day
Column 4: Neumayer CH4 mole fraction in ppb
Column 5: individual error in ppb (1 sigma standard deviation + error propagation)
Column 6: Neumayer d13C(CH4) data in permil versus V-PDB
Column 7: individual error in permil point (1 sigma standard deviation + error propagation)

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
